Alert.tsx.description:
Use an alert to inform users of important information.
To display an alert in a toast notification, use the toast module.

onRequestClose.description: If used, a close button will be attached to the alert box.
onRequestClose.name: onRequestClose

id.description: A unique id used for accessibility purposes
id.name: id

children.description: Optionally render children if a title is not specified. Used for custom alerts.

intent.description: Changes the icon and colour of the alert.

link.description: Returns an <a> HTML element and sets the href attribute value

padStart.description:
Pads the current string with a given string (possibly repeated) so that the resulting string reaches a given length.
The padding is applied from the start (left) of the current string.
@param maxLength The length of the resulting string once the current string has been padded.
If this parameter is smaller than the current string's length, the current string will be returned as it is.
@param fillString The string to pad the current string with.
If this string is too long, it will be truncated and the left-most part will be applied.
The default value for this parameter is " " (U+0020).
padStart.name: padStart

padEnd.description:
Pads the current string with a given string (possibly repeated) so that the resulting string reaches a given length.
The padding is applied from the end (right) of the current string.
@param maxLength The length of the resulting string once the current string has been padded.
If this parameter is smaller than the current string's length, the current string will be returned as it is.
@param fillString The string to pad the current string with.
If this string is too long, it will be truncated and the left-most part will be applied.
The default value for this parameter is " " (U+0020).
padEnd.name: padEnd

heights.

Embed.tsx.description:
The Embed component maintains the provided aspect ratio determined
by the width and height props. It's useful for avoiding content shifting on image
loading.

interactive icon elements.

A Navbar is used to provide app based navigation. Typically
used in combination with a Toolbar.

Popover.tsx.description:
Display popover contents in a bottom sheet if
on mobile devices. I generally find that this provides a
better use experience on smaller screens.

Sheet.tsx.description:
A sheet is useful for displaying app based navigation (typically on the left),
supplemental information (on the right), or menu options (typically
from the bottom on mobile devices).

Sheets should not be tied to specific URLs.

onRequestClose.description: A callback to handle closing the sheet
onRequestClose.name: onRequestClose

position.description:
The position of the sheet.
'left' is typically used for navigation,
'right' for additional information,
'bottom' for responsive modal popovers.
position.name: position

isOpen.description: Whether the item being positioned is visible
isOpen.name: isOpen

target.description: The element our positioner is targetting (eg, Button)
target.name: target

children.description: The render callback which contains positioning and animation info
children.name: children

find.description:
Returns the value of the first element in the array where predicate is true, and undefined
otherwise.
@param predicate find calls predicate once for each element of the array, in ascending
order, until it finds one where predicate returns true. If such an element is found, find
immediately returns that element value. Otherwise, find returns undefined.
@param thisArg If provided, it will be used as the this value for each invocation of
predicate. If it is not provided, undefined is used instead.
find.name: find

type.name: { <S extends Ref<T>>(predicate: (this: void, value: Ref<T>, index: number, obj: Ref<T>[]) => value is S, thisArg?: any): S; (predicate: (value: Ref<T>, index: number, obj: Ref<T>[]) => boolean, thisArg?: any): Ref<...>; }

findIndex.description:
Returns the index of the first element in the array where predicate is true, and -1
otherwise.
@param predicate find calls predicate once for each element of the array, in ascending
order, until it finds one where predicate returns true. If such an element is found,
findIndex immediately returns that element index. Otherwise, findIndex returns -1.
@param thisArg If provided, it will be used as the this value for each invocation of
predicate. If it is not provided, undefined is used instead.
findIndex.name: findIndex

type.name: (predicate: (value: Ref<T>, index: number, obj: Ref<T>[]) => boolean, thisArg?: any) => number

flatMap.description:
Calls a defined callback function on each element of an array. Then, flattens the result into
a new array.
This is identical to a map followed by flat with depth 1.
@param callback A function that accepts up to three arguments. The flatMap method calls the
callback function one time for each element in the array.
@param thisArg An object to which the this keyword can refer in the callback function. If
thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.
flatMap.name: flatMap

type.name: <U, This = undefined>(callback: (this: This, value: Ref<T>, index: number, array: Ref<T>[]) => U | ReadonlyArray<U>, thisArg?: This) => U[]

flat.name: flat

Hooks/use-uid.ts.description:
Generate a unique id for a component.
Useful for accessibility controls (htmlFor, describedBy)

codePointAt.description:
Returns a nonnegative integer Number less than 1114112 (0x110000) that is the code point
value of the UTF-16 encoded code point starting at the string element at position pos in
the String resulting from converting this object to a String.
If there is no element at that position, the result is undefined.
If a valid UTF-16 surrogate pair does not begin at pos, the result is the code unit at pos.
codePointAt.name: codePointAt

padStart.description:
Pads the current string with a given string (possibly repeated) so that the resulting string reaches a given length.
The padding is applied from the start (left) of the current string.
@param maxLength The length of the resulting string once the current string has been padded.
If this parameter is smaller than the current string's length, the current string will be returned as it is.
@param fillString The string to pad the current string with.
If this string is too long, it will be truncated and the left-most part will be applied.
The default value for this parameter is " " (U+0020).
padStart.name: padStart

padEnd.description:
Pads the current string with a given string (possibly repeated) so that the resulting string reaches a given length.
The padding is applied from the end (right) of the current string.
@param maxLength The length of the resulting string once the current string has been padded.
If this parameter is smaller than the current string's length, the current string will be returned as it is.
@param fillString The string to pad the current string with.
If this string is too long, it will be truncated and the left-most part will be applied.
The default value for this parameter is " " (U+0020).
padEnd.name: padEnd
